title: Authors and Citation
text: Lemb J (2024). cyclingdata: comprehensive dataset stage-races professional cycling. R package version 0.1.0, https://jenslemb.github.io/cyclingdata/, https://github.com/jenslemb/cyclingdata.
code: @Manual{,   title = {cyclingdata: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling},   author = {Jens Lemb},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0, https://jenslemb.github.io/cyclingdata/},   url = {https://github.com/jenslemb/cyclingdata}, }

what: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling
title: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling
text: cyclingdata package contains two main components enables users access analyze data professional cycling: comprehensive dataset (cyclingdata) stage-level information 11,125 stages across 120 years cycling. dataset comprises Grand Tours major one-week stage races professional cycling. function (cyclingscraper) allows users harvest data professional cycling. function accesses requested race https://www.procyclingstats.com converts HTML code dataframe containing stage-level information. following sections present overview contents package install use .

title: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling
text: cyclingdata presents comprehensive dataset major stage races professional cycling scraped https://www.procyclingstats.com. following races included: Tour de France Giro d’Italia La Vuelta Ciclista España Critérium du Dauphiné Itzulia Basque Country Paris-Nice Tirreno-Adriatico Tour de Pologne Tour de Romandie Tour de Suisse Volta Ciclista Catalunya … come (see Future releases ) dataset includes 11,125 stages 1903 2024 contains range stage characteristics stage won (assuming ’s completed). See function reference cyclingdata information data.

title: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling
code: # Install the development version from GitHub devtools::install_github("jenslemb/cyclingdata")

title: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling
text: can access data simply loading package calling cyclingdata. entire dataset races years loaded default.

title: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling
text: can subset data using common methods. example using dplyr.
code: library(dplyr)  cyclingdata |>    filter(race == "Tour de France")  cyclingdata |>    filter(year == 2023)

title: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling
text: cyclingscraper() allows scrape race data directly https://www.procyclingstats.com. can request multiple races years. Please see function reference details accepted arguments.
code: cyclingscraper(races = c("tdf", "giro", "vuelta"), years = 2022:2023)  cyclingscraper(races = c("tdf", "giro", "vuelta"), years = "all")

title: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling
text: encounter clear bug, please file issue minimal reproducible example GitHub. also welcome shoot email jenslemb@gmail.com questions comments.

title: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling
text: currently working adding races, including monuments major one-day races. also add race results rider info future. Follow updates changelog.

what: Check whether a race was completed in a given year. — checkrace
title: Check whether a race was completed in a given year. — checkrace
text: function internal use functions racedata raceinfo ensure webscraping procedure return error.

title: Check whether a race was completed in a given year. — checkrace
Check whether a race was completed in a given year. — checkrace
text: race character race identifier. See details. year number corresponding requested race year format: YYYY.

title: Check whether a race was completed in a given year. — checkrace
text: Error message race conducted requested year. Otherwise nothing.

title: Check whether a race was completed in a given year. — checkrace
text: race parameter accepts following inputs: "tdf" (Tour de France) "giro" (Giro d'Italia) "vuelta" (La Vuelta ciclista España) "dauphine" (Critérium du Dauphiné) "suisse" (Tour de Suisse) "tirreno" (Tirreno-Adriatico) "parisnice" (Paris-Nice) "romandie" (Tour de Romandie) "catalunya" (Volta Ciclista Catalunya) "pologne" (Tour de Pologne) "basque" (Itzulia Basque Country)

title: Check whether a race was completed in a given year. — checkrace

what: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling — cyclingdata
title: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling — cyclingdata
text: comprehensive dataset race-level information Grand Tours major one-week stage races professional cycling.

title: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling — cyclingdata
A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling — cyclingdata
text: data frame 11,125 rows 18 columns: race Race name. year Year. stage Stage name. stage_id Stage ID extracted stage name (e.g., prologue, 1, 2a, 2b). stage_num Stage number order completion within given race (e.g., prologue, stage 1, stage 2a, stage 2b   assigned 1, 2, 3, 4, respectively). stage_type Stage type (Prologue, Road race, ITT, TTT). date Date race. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. departure Location departure. arrival Location arrival. parcours_type Stage profile type. (Hills uphill finish,   Hills flat finish, Flat, Mountains flat finish, Mountains uphill finish). distance Race length kilometers. vertical_meters Number vertical meters. profile_score Numeric value race difficulty. See:   https://www.procyclingstats.com/info/profile-score-explained startlist_quality Numeric value quality riders start   race. See: https://www.procyclingstats.com/calendar/uci/startlist-quality> avg_speed_winner Average speed winner km/h. won_how Description race won. win_type Category win type (Solo, Sprint à deux, Large group sprint,   Small group sprint, Unknown type). Small group sprint refers sizes reduced pelotons. Refer won_how details group size. km_solo Length winning solo attack (applies solo wins).

title: A comprehensive dataset on stage-races in professional cycling — cyclingdata
text: https://www.procyclingstats.com

what: Scrape cycling data from procyclingstats.com. — cyclingscraper
title: Scrape cycling data from procyclingstats.com. — cyclingscraper
text: function webscrapes stage-level race data Grand Tours major stage-races professional cycling. function can handle multiple races years.

title: Scrape cycling data from procyclingstats.com. — cyclingscraper
Scrape cycling data from procyclingstats.com. — cyclingscraper
text: races character race identifier vector races. See details examples. years Either number (vector numbers) corresponding requested race year(s) format: YYYY "" available race years. Default "". ... Additional arguments passed racedata. Can : progress Logical value indicating whether function print progress. Default TRUE sleep number corresponding seconds sleep time HTML requests. Default 1

title: Scrape cycling data from procyclingstats.com. — cyclingscraper
text: dataframe containing stage-level data races year following variables included: race, year, stage, races, stage_num, stage_type, date, departure, arrival, parcours_type, distance, vertical_meters, profile_score, startlist_quality, avg_speed_winner, won_how, win_type km_solo.

title: Scrape cycling data from procyclingstats.com. — cyclingscraper
text: races parameter accepts following inputs: "tdf" (Tour de France) "giro" (Giro d'Italia) "vuelta" (La Vuelta ciclista España) "dauphine" (Critérium du Dauphiné) "suisse" (Tour de Suisse) "tirreno" (Tirreno-Adriatico) "parisnice" (Paris-Nice) "romandie" (Tour de Romandie) "catalunya" (Volta Ciclista Catalunya) "pologne" (Tour de Pologne) "basque" (Itzulia Basque Country)

title: Scrape cycling data from procyclingstats.com. — cyclingscraper
code: #' The examples are not evaluated due to long run time. Remove `if (FALSE) {}` to run.  if (FALSE) {  cyclingscraper(races = c("tdf", "giro", "vuelta"), years = 2010:2023)  cyclingscraper(races = "tdf", years = "all")  cyclingscraper(races = c("suisse", "dauphine"), years = 2022)  cyclingscraper(races = "tdf", years = c(1996, 2022, 2023), progress = FALSE, sleep = 2)  }

what: Scrape stage data from procyclingstats.com. — racedata
title: Scrape stage data from procyclingstats.com. — racedata
text: function internal use cyclingscraper retrieve stage-level data.

title: Scrape stage data from procyclingstats.com. — racedata
Scrape stage data from procyclingstats.com. — racedata
text: race character race identifier. See details. year number corresponding requested race year format: YYYY progress Logical value indicating whether function print progress. Default TRUE. sleep number corresponding seconds sleep time HTML requests ensure servers overloaded. Minimum value 1 (second) also default.

title: Scrape stage data from procyclingstats.com. — racedata
text: dataframe containing stage-level data races year following variables included: race, year, stage, races, stage_num, stage_type, date, departure, arrival, parcours_type, distance, vertical_meters, profile_score, startlist_quality, avg_speed_winner, won_how, win_type km_solo.

title: Scrape stage data from procyclingstats.com. — racedata
text: race parameter accepts following inputs: "tdf" (Tour de France) "giro" (Giro d'Italia) "vuelta" (La Vuelta ciclista España) "dauphine" (Critérium du Dauphiné) "suisse" (Tour de Suisse) "tirreno" (Tirreno-Adriatico) "parisnice" (Paris-Nice) "romandie" (Tour de Romandie) "catalunya" (Volta Ciclista Catalunya) "pologne" (Tour de Pologne) "basque" (Itzulia Basque Country)

title: Scrape race information from procyclingstats.com. — raceinfo
code: raceinfo("tdf", 2022) #> # A tibble: 21 × 3 #>    stage                                                    stage_id stage_type #>    <chr>                                                    <chr>    <chr>      #>  1 Stage 1 (ITT) | Copenhagen - Copenhagen                  1        ITT        #>  2 Stage 2 | Roskilde - Nyborg                              2        Road race  #>  3 Stage 3 | Vejle - Sønderborg                             3        Road race  #>  4 Stage 4 | Dunkerque - Calais                             4        Road race  #>  5 Stage 5 | Lille - Wallers-Arenberg                       5        Road race  #>  6 Stage 6 | Binche - Longwy                                6        Road race  #>  7 Stage 7 | Tomblaine - La Super Planche des Belles Filles 7        Road race  #>  8 Stage 8 | Dole - Lausanne                                8        Road race  #>  9 Stage 9 | Aigle - Châtel les portes du Soleil            9        Road race  #> 10 Stage 10 | Morzine - Megève                              10       Road race  #> # ℹ 11 more rows
